paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Age range 30-70 years, both male and female

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 presented with symptoms of peripheral neuropathy at age 30.
Patient P2 was diagnosed with progressive neuropathy at age 42.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic at age 50.
Patient P4 developed gastrointestinal symptoms at age 55.

functional_data.summary: The Val117Ala variant in TTR leads to misfolding and amyloid deposition.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected family members.
variants.population_frequency: Not reported in gnomAD or ExAC.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple family studies.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met variant is the most common but Val117Ala is also significant.
key_quotes: The most common is a Val30Met point mutation, occurring in ~ 85% of FAP patients.
However, it has been demonstrated that ocular and cardiac disease can progress despite LT.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was clearly presented in the main text.
